summary: An Ordinance providing for the improvement of Corliss Avenue, from a point about 120 feet north of East Green Lake Boulevard to North Eighty-fifth Street; North Eightieth Street, from Wallingford Avenue to Stroud Avenue; Stroud Avenue, from North Eightieth Street to a point about 120 feet north of East Green Lake Boulevard; the alley running parallel with and about 120 feet north of East Green Lake Boulevard, from Stroud Avenue to Sunnyside Avenue; Sunnyside Avenue, from a point about 120 feet north of East Green Lake Boulevard to North Seventy-fifth Street; North Seventy-fifth Street, from Sunnyside Avenue to Woodlawn Avenue; Woodlawn Avenue, from North Seventy-fifth Street to Latona Avenue, all in the City of Seattle, by attaching fire hydrants to the existing water mains therein, in accordance with Resolution No. 1522 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Immediate Payment," as provided by the laws of the State of Washington and the Charter and Ordinances of the City of Seattle
